sentence.Network_en: The Beaujolais hills are ravishingly pretty.
sentence.Network_cn: 博若莱山风景十分美丽。

RelatedPhrase.word: be exquisitely dainty and ravishingly beautiful

list.key: be exquisitely dainty and ravishingly beautiful
list.abs: 秦国秦城... ... 4.金枝玉叶： descendants of royal families 2.千娇百媚： be exquisitely dainty and ravishingly beautiful.

entry.tran: 非常美丽的；销魂的；引人入胜的
entry.def: If you describe someone or something as ravishing, you mean that they are very beautiful.

example.ex: ...driving through the ravishing scenery of Cumbria and Yorkshire.
example.tran: 开车经过风景如画的坎布里亚郡和约克郡

means.word_mean: 1. in a ravishing manner or to a ravishing degree;

auth_sentence.content: Few songs catch love in all its agony and ecstasy more ravishingly than Roberta Flack's The First Time Ever I Saw Your Face.
auth_sentence.res_content: Few songs catch love in all its agony and ecstasy more ravishingly than Roberta Flack's The First Time Ever I Saw Your Face.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Few songs catch love in all its agony and ecstasy more ravishingly than Roberta Flack's The First Time Ever I Saw Your Face.

auth_sentence.content: Try to imagine how soul-ravishingly tedious an Obama speech would be if it were about him.
auth_sentence.res_content: Try to imagine how soul-ravishingly tedious an Obama speech would be if it were about him.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Try to imagine how soul-ravishingly tedious an Obama speech would be if it were about him.

auth_sentence.content: No one that ravishingly handsome should have to pine so furiously to inhale a loved-one's hair.
auth_sentence.res_content: No one that ravishingly handsome should have to pine so furiously to inhale a loved-one's hair.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: No one that ravishingly handsome should have to pine so furiously to inhale a loved-one's hair.
